tagline.en: I design data-driven decision systems: causal inference + interpretable predictive modeling for business intelligence, and sensor-fusion motion analytics for bioengineering.
tagline.it: Progetto sistemi decisionali data-driven: inferenza causale e modelli predittivi interpretabili per la business intelligence, e motion analytics con sensor fusion per la bioingegneria.

description.en: Building ML solutions for business intelligence services: interpretable forecasting, explainability, and causal discovery for decision support.
description.it: Sviluppo soluzioni di ML per servizi di business intelligence: forecasting interpretabile, explainability e causal discovery per supportare le decisioni.

activities.en: Interpretable forecasting and business driver analysis
activities.it: Forecasting interpretabile e analisi dei driver di business

activities.en: Explainability tooling (e.g., SHAP) to understand variable impact
activities.it: Explainability (es. SHAP) per comprendere l'impatto delle variabili

notes: Research focus: telerehabilitation with biofeedback (non-immersive VR)
Worked with EMG signals to construct rehabilitative biofeedback, including idiopathic scoliosis context
Platforms/languages: Android, Unity (C#), Python, C++, Django, Matlab

education.degree: Master's Degree in Bioengineering — Biomedical Technologies and Engineering for Health
notes: Curriculum in Biomedical Technologies and Engineering for Health
Skills across biomedical data/signal analysis, biomedical informatics, bioimaging, perceptual/interactive systems, clinical engineering, and health information systems
Thesis: Android application for visualization and real-time processing of pressure values measured with flexible transducers (Electromedical Instrumentation 2)

background.focus: Machine learning for business intelligence services: interpretable forecasting, explainability (driver analysis), causal discovery, and decision-ready delivery via microservices-oriented interfaces.
Django-based management systems; Unity development; AI algorithms; business intelligence modeling with geometric deep learning patterns, clustering, and Bayesian networks.
Enabled Bluetooth communication for wearable systems in Android; built an immersive VR demonstrator (Oculus Quest 1) for a sensorized automotive environment; collected HRV and pressure data.
Research on neuromotor home telerehabilitation for post-stroke outcomes; followed a thesis on exergame design and development.
Android app for real-time visualization of electrophysiological signals via Bluetooth (ECG + respiration), with synchronized recording for offline analysis.

background.role: Research on telerehabilitation for adolescent idiopathic scoliosis
background.focus: Led development of a telerehabilitation platform with real-time EMG acquisition on Android and remote recording; co-supervised undergraduate theses in EMG monitoring and rehab support platforms.
Studied and modified configurable assistive medical technology systems for the European telecare project HEREiAM; planned integrations of medical devices (e.g., glucometer, coagulometer).

background.role: Educational Tutor — Analog & Digital Electronic Design
background.focus: Tutoring and support for a 10-credit course on analog and digital electronic design for biomedical engineering students.
Participated in a telemedicine project (C/C++/Matlab, WFDB); contributed to web platform design work (HTML/CSS/JS, AngularJS).

Designed and built an electronic board to transmit pressure-mat data to an Android smartphone via Bluetooth; supported PCB design/fabrication/soldering and Android app development for data collection.
Support role for incoming students; provided overview metrics on first-year academic performance to the course committee.

operatingSystem.title: Operating System
operatingSystem.lead: Decision rules that keep the ecosystem coherent as it scales.

blocks.title: Boundary & governance
items: Governance is functional: each container answers one question.
BMI: does this knowledge need to exist even if the market disappears?
For-profit: does this knowledge create economic value if applied now?
If the boundary decision is ambiguous → it stays in BMI.

blocks.title: IP & data placement
items: IP originates in BMI; exploitation is optional, deferred, and selective.
Data belongs to the truth layer that makes it interpretable.
If a dataset improves the model → BMI; if it improves service delivery → for-profit.

blocks.title: Scaling & stop rules
items: Scale modules, reuse, licenses, and interpretations — not user cognitive complexity.
Stop if it’s not modellable, explainable, and verifiable.
Stop if it forces boundary ambiguity or epistemic compromises.

services.title: Causal Inference / Causal Discovery
services.description: Causal graphs, treatment effect reasoning, strategic decision support

services.title: Data Pipeline Engineering
services.description: Modular pipelines, config-driven workflows, reproducibility, testing

services.title: Bioengineering & Wearables R&D
services.description: IMU/EMG signals, sensor fusion, movement analytics, tele-rehab systems

projects.name: BMI — Bioingegneria Modulare Italiana
projects.tagline: Biomedical R&D container: reusable scientific infrastructure + modular clinical/biomed components.
projects.purpose: Build a reusable biomedical engineering stack (acquisition → processing → modeling) that can be transferred into applied products without rewriting the core.
whatIBuild: Reusable acquisition/instrumentation layers (IMU + low-cost real-time EMG)
Python-first modules with explicit I/O, logging, versioning, tests, reproducible configs
Research-grade building blocks that can be verticalized elsewhere (e.g., movement analytics, decision support)
outputs: Android acquisition app foundation (IMU) and real-time EMG integration
Reusable preprocessing/synchronization patterns and data schemas
Concept frameworks for longitudinal modeling (patient digital twin)

contained.name: bmyCure4MM
contained.tagline: Biomedical AI / decision support: patient digital twin with longitudinal response + side-effects.

contained.name: bmySquat
contained.tagline: Biomechanics module track within BMI (structure-first, reusable components).

contained.name: Sensor acquisition stack
contained.tagline: Android IMU acquisition + synchronization/streaming/buffering + EMG real-time integration.

projects.name: SketchData
projects.tagline: BI/automation container: interpretable ML, causal reasoning, and modular data pipelines.
projects.purpose: Turn business data into decision-ready outputs, with an architecture that stays modular as complexity grows (local → parallel → cloud/API).
whatIBuild: Config-driven pipelines with explicit component I/O (swap modules without rewiring the whole system)
Interpretable forecasting and driver analysis (SHAP) for actionability
Causal discovery/inference workflows for strategic decisions

contained.name: RADIAL
contained.tagline: Decision support module family (reports, dashboards, APIs).

projects.name: IGM — Ingegneria del Movimento
projects.tagline: Movement analytics product container built on wearable sensors (IMU/EMG).
projects.purpose: Ship a usable movement-analysis experience (panel, metrics, workflows) by reusing BMI’s core acquisition/instrumentation stack.
whatIBuild: Applied movement analysis: segmentation, phase detection, interpretable biomechanical metrics
Product-facing analysis panel (visualization, reporting, UX for practical use)
Validation-minded engineering: deterministic tests, diagnostics, reproducible runs
outputs: Instrumentation/QA improvements (e.g., deterministic Android UI tests)

contained.name: gym_IMU
contained.tagline: Android instrumentation tests: permission flows, deterministic UI tests, removing sleeps, gating/diagnostics.

contained.name: IMU/EMG analysis panel
contained.tagline: Interpretation/visualization layer on top of the shared acquisition base.

projects.name: FZTM — From Zero to Million
projects.tagline: Quant finance + educational systems: scenarios, constraints, and decision dashboards.
projects.purpose: Make financial decisions explicit via models, assumptions, and stress-tested scenarios (automation-first, output-driven).
whatIBuild: Automation-first calculators and reporting (CSV/Excel/JSON as needed)
Dashboards that surface decision variables (not just charts)

projects.name: ES — Esercizi Svolti
projects.tagline: Educational container: structured problem-solving systems (not an archive).
projects.purpose: Increase learning value via structure, method, tooling, and progression—beyond generic exercise repositories.
whatIBuild: Problem → solution libraries with method-driven explanations
Structured learning paths and evaluation criteria
Tooling-first approach to reduce manual repetition
outputs: Templates and structured formats for consistent delivery

collaborationModes.description: From problem definition to proof-of-concept and reproducible experiments
Data pipelines + interpretable ML + causal analysis into operational dashboards/APIs
Sensor fusion + biomechanical metrics + validation approach

capabilities: Interpretable predictive modeling for business intelligence
Analytics delivery via web interfaces and APIs
